block_device/devices/default.description: Default attributes for all block devices.
block_device/devices/default.title: Block Device Defaults

block_device/devices/device3.description: Attributes for the block device: device3.
block_device/devices/device3.title: Block Device 3

block_device/devices/device2.description: Attributes for the block device: device2.
block_device/devices/device2.title: Block Device 2

block_device/devices/device1.description: Attributes for the block device: device1.
block_device/devices/device1.title: Block Device 1

block_device/devices/device3/backup/line.description: If defined, this will override the input defined for 'Backup Lineage' (block_device/devices/device3/backup/lineage) so that you can restore the volume from another backup that has as a different lineage name. The most recently completed snapshots will be used unless a specific timestamp value is specified for 'Restore Timestamp Override' (block_device/devices/device3/backup/timestamp_override).

block_device/devices/device3/volume_size.description: Defines the total size of the LVM volume stripe set (in GB). For example, if the stripe_count is '3' and you specify '3' for this input, it will create an LVM volume stripe that contains 3 volumes that are each 1 GB in size. If an uneven ratio is defined, volume sizes will be rounded up to the nearest whole integer. Ignored on clouds that do not support volumes (e.g., Rackspace).

block_device/devices/device3/stripe_coun.display_name: Number of Volumes in the Stripe (3)
block_device/devices/device3/stripe_coun.description: The total number of volumes in the volume stripe that will be used by the database. Volumes will be created and mounted to the instance. The default value is 1, which means that only a single volume will be used (no striping). This value is ignored on clouds that do not support volumes (e.g., Rackspace).

block_device/devices/device2/vg_data_per.display_name: Percentage of the LVM used for data (2)
block_device/devices/device2/vg_data_per.description: The percentage of the total Volume Group extents (LVM) that is used for data. (e.g. 50 percent - 1/2 used for data and remainder used for overhead and snapshots, 100 percent - all space is allocated for data (therefore snapshots can not be taken) WARNING: If the space used for data storage is too large, LVM snapshots cannot be performed. Using a non-default value it not reccommended. Make sure you understand what you are doing before changing this value.

block_device/devices/device2/backup/prim.description: The maximum number of primary backups to keep in addition to those being rotated.
Defines the hour when the backup will be taken. Use a value of 1-24, or set to 'Ignore' to create a backup every hour.
Defines the minute of the hour when the backup will be taken. Use a value of 1-59, or set to 'Ignore' and a random minute will be calculated.

block_device/devices/device2/nickname.description: The name displayed in the dashboard for volumes and to uniquely identify LVM volume groups.

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: The maximum number of primary backups to keep in addition to those being rotated.

block_device/devices/device2/backup/prim.description: The number of daily primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device2/stripe_coun.display_name: Number of Volumes in the Stripe (2)
block_device/devices/device2/stripe_coun.description: The total number of volumes in the volume stripe that will be used by the database. Volumes will be created and mounted to the instance. The default value is 1, which means that only a single volume will be used (no striping). This value is ignored on clouds that do not support volumes (e.g., Rackspace).

block_device/terminate_safety.description: Prevents the accidental running of the block_device::do_teminate_server recipe. The recipe will only run if the input variable is overridden and set to "off".
choice: Override the dropdown and set to "off" to really run this recipe
block_device/terminate_safety.default: Override the dropdown and set to "off" to really run this recipe

block_device/devices/device3/iops.description: The input/output operations per second (IOPS) that the volue can support. IOPS is currently only supported on Amazon EC2. Example: 500

block_device/devices/device1/backup/prim.description: The number of monthly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).
Defines the hour when the backup will be taken. Use a value of 1-24, or set to 'Ignore' to create a backup every hour.

block_device/devices/default/backup/seco.description: The secondary backup storage cloud. Specify 'S3' for Amazon, and 'cloudfiles' for Rackspace.

block_device/devices/default/backup/prim.description: Primary cloud authentication credentials. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace account API key (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_AUTH_KEY). For clouds that do not require primary credentials (e.g., Amazon), set to 'ignore'.

block_device/devices_to_use.description: The block device(s) to operate on. Can be a comma-separated list of device names or '*' to indicate all devices. Example: device1

block_device/devices/device2/backup/line.description: If defined, this will override the input defined for 'Backup Lineage' (block_device/devices/device2/backup/lineage) so that you can restore the volume from another backup that has as a different lineage name. The most recently completed snapshots will be used unless a specific timestamp value is specified for 'Restore Timestamp Override' (block_device/devices/device2/backup/timestamp_override).

block_device/devices/device1/mount_point.description: The directory of where to mount the block device (e.g., /mnt/storage).

block_device/devices/default/backup/prim.description: Primary cloud authentication credentials. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace login username (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_USERNAME). For clouds that do not require primary credentials (e.g., Amazon), set to 'ignore'.

block_device/devices/device3/nickname.description: The name displayed in the dashboard for volumes and to uniquely identify LVM volume groups.

block_device/devices/device2/backup/seco.description: The secondary backup storage container where the backup will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

block_device/devices/device2/backup/prim.description: The number of yearly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device1/backup/prim.description: The maximum number of primary backups to keep in addition to those being rotated.
Defines the minute of the hour when the backup will be taken. Use a value of 1-59, or set to 'Ignore' and a random minute will be calculated.

block_device/devices/device1/backup/line.description: If defined, this will override the input defined for 'Backup Lineage' (block_device/devices/device1/backup/lineage) so that you can restore the volume from another backup that has as a different lineage name. The most recently completed snapshots will be used unless a specific timestamp value is specified for 'Restore Timestamp Override' (block_device/devices/device1/backup/timestamp_override).

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: The number of monthly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device2/mount_point.description: The directory of where to mount the block device (e.g., /mnt/storage).

block_device/devices/device1/backup/prim.description: The number of daily primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/default/backup/seco.display_name: Secondary Backup Storage Cloud Endpoint URL (default)
block_device/devices/default/backup/seco.description: The endpoint URL for the secondary backup storage cloud. This is used to override the default endpoint or for generic storage clouds such as Swift.

block_device/devices/default/backup/prim.display_name: Primary Backup Storage Cloud Endpoint URL (default)
block_device/devices/default/backup/prim.description: The endpoint URL for the primary backup storage cloud. This is used to override the default endpoint or for generic storage clouds such as Swift.

block_device/devices/device3/backup/seco.description: The secondary backup storage container where the backup will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: The number of weekly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device1/iops.description: The input/output operations per second (IOPS) that the volue can support. IOPS is currently only supported on Amazon EC2. Example: 500

block_device/devices/device1/backup/time.description: Another optional variable to restore from a specific timestamp. Specify a string matching the timestamp tags on the volume snapshot set. You will need to specify the timestamp that's defined by the snapshot's tag (not name). For example, if the snapshot's tag is 'rs_backup:timestamp=1303613371' you would specify '1303613371' for this input.

block_device/devices/device1/nickname.description: The name displayed in the dashboard for volumes and to uniquely identify LVM volume groups.

block_device/devices/default/backup/seco.description: Secondary cloud authentication credentials. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace account API key (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_AUTH_KEY). For Amazon S3, use your Amazon secret key (e.g., cred:AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY).

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: Defines the hour when the backup will be taken. Use a value of 1-24, or set to 'Ignore' to create a backup every hour.

block_device/devices/device3/backup/time.description: Another optional variable to restore from a specific timestamp. Specify a string matching the timestamp tags on the volume snapshot set. You will need to specify the timestamp that's defined by the snapshot's tag (not name). For example, if the snapshot's tag is 'rs_backup:timestamp=1303613371' you would specify '1303613371' for this input.

block_device/devices/device2/backup/time.description: Another optional variable to restore from a specific timestamp. Specify a string matching the timestamp tags on the volume snapshot set. You will need to specify the timestamp that's defined by the snapshot's tag (not name). For example, if the snapshot's tag is 'rs_backup:timestamp=1303613371' you would specify '1303613371' for this input.

block_device/devices/device2/volume_size.description: Defines the total size of the LVM volume stripe set (in GB). For example, if the stripe_count is '3' and you specify '3' for this input, it will create an LVM volume stripe that contains 3 volumes that are each 1 GB in size. If an uneven ratio is defined, volume sizes will be rounded up to the nearest whole integer. Ignored on clouds that do not support volumes (e.g., Rackspace).

block_device/devices/device1/vg_data_per.display_name: Percentage of the LVM used for data (1)
block_device/devices/device1/vg_data_per.description: The percentage of the total Volume Group extents (LVM) that is used for data. (e.g. 50 percent - 1/2 used for data and remainder used for overhead and snapshots, 100 percent - all space is allocated for data (therefore snapshots can not be taken) WARNING: If the space used for data storage is too large, LVM snapshots cannot be performed. Using a non-default value it not reccommended. Make sure you understand what you are doing before changing this value.

block_device/devices/device1/stripe_coun.display_name: Number of Volumes in the Stripe (1)
block_device/devices/device1/stripe_coun.description: The total number of volumes in the volume stripe that will be used by the database. Volumes will be created and mounted to the instance. The default value is 1, which means that only a single volume will be used (no striping). This value is ignored on clouds that do not support volumes (e.g., Rackspace).

block_device/devices/device3/vg_data_per.display_name: Percentage of the LVM used for data (3)
block_device/devices/device3/vg_data_per.description: The percentage of the total Volume Group extents (LVM) that is used for data. (e.g. 50 percent - 1/2 used for data and remainder used for overhead and snapshots, 100 percent - all space is allocated for data (therefore snapshots can not be taken) WARNING: If the space used for data storage is too large, LVM snapshots cannot be performed. Using a non-default value it not reccommended. Make sure you understand what you are doing before changing this value.

block_device/devices/device3/mount_point.description: The directory of where to mount the block device (e.g., /mnt/storage).

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: The number of yearly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device2/backup/prim.description: The number of monthly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device1/backup/seco.description: The secondary backup storage container where the backup will be saved to or restored from. For Amazon S3, use the bucket name. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use the container name.

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: The number of daily primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device3/backup/line.description: The name associated with your primary and secondary database backups. It's used to associate them with your database environment for maintenance, restore, and replication purposes. Backup snapshots will automatically be tagged with this value (e.g. rs_backup:lineage=mysqlbackup). Backups are identified by their lineage name. Note: For servers running on Rackspace, this value also indicates the Cloud Files container to use for storing primary backups. If a Cloud Files container with this name does not already exist, one will automatically be created.

block_device/devices/device2/backup/line.description: The name associated with your primary and secondary database backups. It's used to associate them with your database environment for maintenance, restore, and replication purposes. Backup snapshots will automatically be tagged with this value (e.g. rs_backup:lineage=mysqlbackup). Backups are identified by their lineage name. Note: For servers running on Rackspace, this value also indicates the Cloud Files container to use for storing primary backups. If a Cloud Files container with this name does not already exist, one will automatically be created.

block_device/devices/device1/backup/prim.description: The number of yearly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/default/backup/seco.description: Secondary cloud authentication credentials. For Rackspace Cloud Files, use your Rackspace login username (e.g., cred:RACKSPACE_USERNAME). For Amazon S3, use your Amazon key ID (e.g., cred:AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID).

block_device/force_safety.description: Prevents the accidental running of the block_device::do_force_reset recipe. The recipe will only run if the input variable is overridden and set to "off".
choice: Override the dropdown and set to "off" to really run this recipe
block_device/force_safety.default: Override the dropdown and set to "off" to really run this recipe

block_device/devices/device3/backup/prim.description: Defines the minute of the hour when the backup will be taken. Use a value of 1-59, or set to 'Ignore' and a random minute will be calculated.

block_device/devices/device2/iops.description: The input/output operations per second (IOPS) that the volue can support. IOPS is currently only supported on Amazon EC2. Example: 500

block_device/devices/device2/backup/prim.description: The number of weekly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device1/backup/prim.description: The number of weekly primary backups to keep (i.e., rotation size).

block_device/devices/device1/backup/line.description: The name associated with your primary and secondary database backups. It's used to associate them with your database environment for maintenance, restore, and replication purposes. Backup snapshots will automatically be tagged with this value (e.g. rs_backup:lineage=mysqlbackup). Backups are identified by their lineage name. Note: For servers running on Rackspace, this value also indicates the Cloud Files container to use for storing primary backups. If a Cloud Files container with this name does not already exist, one will automatically be created.

block_device/devices/device1/volume_size.description: Defines the total size of the LVM volume stripe set (in GB). For example, if the stripe_count is '3' and you specify '3' for this input, it will create an LVM volume stripe that contains 3 volumes that are each 1 GB in size. If an uneven ratio is defined, volume sizes will be rounded up to the nearest whole integer. Ignored on clouds that do not support volumes (e.g., Rackspace).

block_device/devices/default/backup/rack.description: When 'true', Rackspace internal private networking (preferred) is used for communications between servers and Rackspace Cloud Files. Ignored for all other clouds.

block_device/devices/default/backup/prim.description: The primary backup storage cloud. This is only used if the server's cloud does not have volume support.

name: block_device

recipes.block_device::do_primary_backup_schedule: Enables continuous primary backups by updating the crontab file.
recipes.block_device::do_primary_restore: Restores a primary backup from the local cloud where the server is currently running.
recipes.block_device::do_delete_volumes_and_term: Deletes any currently attached volumes from the instance and then terminates the machine. WARNING: Execution of this script will delete any data on your block device!
recipes.block_device::do_secondary_restore: Restores a secondary backup from the remote cloud specified by block_device/secondary provider.

block_device::do_secondary_backup.description: Creates a secondary backup to the remote cloud specified by block_device/secondary provider

recipes.block_device::default: Sets up input dependencies for use by other cookbooks.
recipes.block_device::do_primary_backup_schedule: Disables continuous primary backups by updating the crontab file.

block_device::do_primary_backup.description: Creates a primary backup in the local cloud where the server is currently running.

recipes.block_device::setup_block_device: Creates, formats, and mounts a brand new block device on the instance.
recipes.block_device::do_force_reset: Unmount and delete the attached block device(s) for this lineage. Designed for test and development purposes only. WARNING: Execution of this script will delete any data on your block device!
recipes.block_device::setup_ephemeral: Creates, formats, and mounts a brand new block device on the instance's ephemeral drives. Does nothing on clouds without ephemeral drives.
